_header: That it apertly was apayed for profit that he felt

CamKC13.First Lines:
…Þat it apertly was apayed for profite þat he
                    feld& buxumly by þe bestes wille in wise as it
                    couþe…
CamKC13.Last Lines:
…& god gif ane god grace þat gladli so biddes&
                    pertli in paradis a place for to haue
CamKC13.Editions:
Madden,  Frederick,
                        ed.  
             William and the Werwulf.
Roxburghe Club
         48. London: Nicol, 1832. 
Skeat,  Walter William,
                        ed.  
             The Romance of William of Palerne.
EETS
         e.s. 1 (1867); repr. 1973.
